This long! Colored background tells you if the bus is early (dark indigo) or late (light indigo). On time = normal indigo background. If we don\'t know where the bus is, the scheduled time is shown (light purple background).

"Nautilus Technology is an Australian startup technology company with the vision of" "creating and accelerating competitive advantages through cutting-edge technology and" "solutions.

MyMetro has been launched to provide support to the transit riders of" "Adelaide Metro. MyMetro is a free to use real-time transit platform. The real-time" "transit data is provided by Adelaide Metro Real-Time Data" "Feed (https://www.adelaidemetro.com.au/developer-info).

Visit" "https://nautilus-tech.com.au and https://mymetro.au to find out more.

MyMetro" "is using the OneBusAway transit platform. OneBusWay is a project of the non-profit" "Open Transit Software Foundation (OTSF). It began in 2008 as a graduate student project" "by Brian Ferris and Kari Watkins at the University of Washington and evolved to become" "the topic of both of their PhD dissertations. Find out more about the OneBusAway" "open-source project at https://onebusaway.org.

The project is licensed under" "Apache v2.0 (https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0)."
Light purple means \"Scheduled arrival\" - We don\'t know where the bus is now, but the schedule says there is an upcoming arrival
Light purple with strikethrough means the trip has been canceled - this bus is NOT coming
